servinfo.title: Steering Lower Shaft Assembly Removal and Installation

attention2.ptxt: Never turn steering wheel while steering lower shaft assembly is removed.

Should it have been turned and contact coil cable assembly have got out of its centered position, it needs to be centered again. Also, turning steering wheel more than about two and a half turns will break contact coil cable assembly.

s1.ptxt: Turn steering wheel so that vehicle’s front tires are at straight-ahead position.
Turn ignition switch to LOCK position and remove key.
Make alignment marks (1) on steering upper shaft (2) and steering lower shaft for a guide during reinstallation.
Remove joint bolt (4) and disconnect upper shaft (2) from joint (3).
Remove joint bolt (2) and then remove lower shaft assembly (1).

attention3.ptxt: When yellow paint (3) cannot be confirmed make alignment marks on steering lower shaft assembly lower joint (1) and pinion shaft of P/S gear case assembly (4) for a guide during reinstallation.

s1.ptxt: Check for following conditions before installing lower shaft.

item.ptxt: Front tires of vehicle are at straight-ahead position.
Match mark (6) on gear case and that on pinion shaft (4) are aligned.

s1.ptxt: Install lower shaft (2) to pinion shaft (5), aligning slit (1) in lower shaft with match mark (4) on pinion shaft (5).
Install joint bolt (3) and tighten it to specified torque.

torqueitem.t-part: Steering lower shaft assembly lower joint bolt

s1.ptxt: Install upper shaft (1) to lower shaft (3) it matching to marks (4) made before removal.
Install joint bolt (2). Then tighten it specified torque.

attention3.ptxt: Be sue that front wheels and steering wheel are in straight-ahead position.

torqueitem.t-part: Steering lower shaft assembly upper joint bolt
